title: (x) freeware font used on Jim Sweetwater website - Sneakout {Nicolai}
content:
Howdy Typophiles,

I was referred here by Mike Yanega, Bowfin Printworks.

In early 2005 I designed a website for a client using  
a PC running windows 2000. In the interim I have learned a  
valuable lesson in web design - always document your  
color schemes and font choices.

Recently I was forced to upgrade my OS to XP and  
failed to document my collection of Fonts. Then of  
course the customer called out of the blue requesting  
a site change... DOH!

So my dilemma is, I have searched high and low all  
over the net and have not been able to find the font  
used at [http://www.jimsweetwater.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808060045/http:/www.jimsweetwater.com/ "http://www.jimsweetwater.com")

The font is used all over the home-landing page and is  
also employed as the font for the text buttons and  
headers on the sub pages.

The font is characterized by open (unclosed) lower  
case a, b, d, e, g, & p.

If you can help ID this font I’d be truly grateful.  
I need to create new text buttons and without this font I’ll  
have to recreate every button on the site.

Thanks!

Treblemaker  
SF, CA  
 [http://www.WorldWideTed](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808060045/http:/www.worldwideted/ "http://www.WorldWideTed")

 [‹ (x) Mustard Seed Associates, Restoring Eden, CCSP - Papyrus, Adobe Minion, FF DIN {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808060045/http:/typophile.com/node/19195 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Die falschen Teilnehmer" squarish sans - Nuri {Urban One} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808060045/http:/typophile.com/node/18445 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Treblemaker

comments.content:
Nicolai....

Damn I owe you a beer or three!!!!

Thanks so much for you help.

Treblemaker  
SF, CA  
http:/www.WorldWideTed.com
Hehehehe, you can always rely on Nicolai. Not always present, but when he pops out of the woodworks it’s usually bullseye. Nice catch, dude. :^)
